author: bergmeister
body:
Steps to reproduce
------------------

Install pwsh 6.0.1 via the `apt-get` package repository instructions [here](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/installation/linux.md#ubuntu-1604).
Then update it using Ubuntu's built in Software updater GUI
or try to get the changelog via

```
apt-get changelog powershell
````

Expected behavior
-----------------

It tells me the short product name (PowerShell) and its version.
Also I expect to be able to see the changelog (after having fetched or installed it from the package manager)

Actual behavior
---------------

Something that looks more like a description:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9250262/37561194-875f61b8-2a40-11e8-87f4-d05808643e93.png)

```
$ apt-get changelog powershell
E: Failed to fetch changelog:/powershell.changelog  Changelog unavailable for powershell=6.0.2-1.ubuntu.16.04
````

Environment data
----------------

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```powershell
> $PSVersionTable
Name                           Value                                                                                                                                  
PSVersion                      6.0.2                                                                                                                                         
PSEdition                      Core                                                                                                                                          
GitCommitId                    v6.0.2                                                                                                                                        
OS                             Linux 4.13.0-37-generic #42~16.04.1-Ubuntu SMP Wed Mar 7 16:03:28 UTC 2018
Platform                       Unix                                                                                                                                          
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}                                                                                                                       
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3                                                                                                                                           
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1                                                                                                                                       
WSManStackVersion              3.0           
```
Remark
----------------
I find it unintuitive that there is no `pwsh` alias in the package manager because initially I wanted to do `sudo apt-get update pwsh` and similar for the changelog.
title: Displayed app name of PowerShell is its description in Ubuntu's software updater and is missing changelog
